content.body: This very interesting case came up in Node.js today  -https://github.com/bojavou/disambiguate-namespace
Apparently when `export * as X from 'x'` was specified, we inadvertantly specified value deduping!!?????
content.formatted_body: Apparently when export * as X from 'x' was specified, we inadvertantly specified value deduping!!?????

content.body: that is `export * from './a'; export * from './b'` where both `a` and `b` contain the source text `export * as X from 'x'` IS NOT AMBIGUOUS!
content.formatted_body: that is export * from './a'; export * from './b' where both a and b contain the source text export * as X from 'x' IS NOT AMBIGUOUS!

content.body: might be some V8 / Firefox divergence in the implementation
are we sure this is the correctly specified behaviour and not algorithmically incorrect?
would be interested to hear others' takes on this
